conversation.ja_sentence: ジム、アカウントの整理について話してもらえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely Tracy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 了解です、トレイシー。

conversation.en_sentence: Product A can organize your contacts, accounts, sales deals and documents.
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品Aでは、連絡先、アカウント、営業案件、および書類を整理することができます。

conversation.en_sentence: Where does it keep everything?
conversation.ja_sentence: 全部どこに保存されるんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: It runs in the cloud.
conversation.ja_sentence: このソフトはクラウドの中で走ります。

conversation.en_sentence: So, all you need is a web browser or a mobile device to access everything.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですので、ウェブブラウザまたはモバイル端末があれば全てにアクセス可能です。

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, that's really convenient.
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、それはとても便利ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: I can see how a sales team and management could make use of that.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業チームと経営陣で使えますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, it's great for field reps.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、外回り営業担当者の方々には最適です。

conversation.en_sentence: That way when they're travelling, they can still have access to all of the information back at the office.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社外にいる時でもオフィスにある全ての情報にアクセスしていただけます。

conversation.en_sentence: Tracy, tell them how you start a typical day.
conversation.ja_sentence: トレイシー、君の1日の典型的なスタートの仕方を教えてくれますか。

conversation.en_sentence: The first thing I do is login to Product A and check my home page.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私が最初にすることは製品Aにログインして私のホームページをチェックすることです。

conversation.en_sentence: At the top of the page are my tabs which quickly help me find all of the information I need.
conversation.ja_sentence: ページの一番上には私のタブがあり、私が必要な全ての情報をすぐに見つけるのに役立ちます。

conversation.en_sentence: Then I write my status update.
conversation.ja_sentence: それから私はステータスを更新します。

conversation.en_sentence: What's that used for?
conversation.ja_sentence: それは何のためですか？

conversation.en_sentence: To let my colleagues know what I'm working on now, and collaborate with them.
conversation.ja_sentence: 同僚に現在自分が取り組んでいることを知らせ、協力し合うためです。

conversation.en_sentence: “My dashboard” is where I track the business data that is most important to me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 「マイ・ダッシュボード」は、みなさまにとって最も重要なビジネスデータを追跡する場所です。

conversation.en_sentence: You can follow the business information that matters the most to you.
conversation.ja_sentence: みなさまのそれぞれの業務に1番関係するビジネス情報をフォローしていただくことが出来ます。

conversation.en_sentence: What sort of business data do you use the most often?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのようなビジネスデータを1番頻繁に使用なさりますか？

conversation.en_sentence: As a business manager, I need to track my team's deals to see what stage they're in.
conversation.ja_sentence: ビジネスマネージャとして、私はチームの取引を把握して、みんながどの段階にいるのかを確認する必要があります。

conversation.en_sentence: Can product A do that?
conversation.ja_sentence: 製品Aにはそれができますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely, you can see all of your team's deals.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、出来ます、チームの取引を全部見ていただくことが可能です。

conversation.en_sentence: You can even set permissions to let them see each others deals.
conversation.ja_sentence: お互いの取引が見れるように権限を設定していただくこともできます。

conversation.en_sentence: Wow, this is really useful!
conversation.ja_sentence: うわー、本当に便利ですね！

conversation.en_sentence: How are the office rent negotiations going?
conversation.ja_sentence: 事務所の賃料の交渉はどうなってる？

conversation.en_sentence: The owner is demanding a 20 percent increase.
conversation.ja_sentence: 貸主は20%の家賃上乗せを要求して来てるのよ。

conversation.en_sentence: If he doesn't change his mind, we should probably look for a new office.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし彼の気が変わらないようなら、他の事務所を探さないといけないかもね。

conversation.en_sentence: That's not a bad idea.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのほうが良いかもね。

conversation.en_sentence: If we were to find a new place, we need to consider what is most important.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし新しい場所を探すなら、何が1番大事か考えないとね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, if we found a location further away from downtown, we could probably get a bigger office for less money.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうね、ダウンタウンから遠い場所なら多分安い金額でもっと大きい事務所が借りられるよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Since our company is growing, we could use the extra space.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの会社はどんどん大きくなってるから、そうなればもっとスペースが使えるわね。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds good, but we can't be too far out.
conversation.ja_sentence: それがいいな、でもあまり遠いのもね。

conversation.en_sentence: Employees won't want to drive that far each day to come to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 従業員達は毎日通勤するのに誰もそんなに長距離運転したくないだろうからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, some of them use public transportation, so we shouldn't be too far away from a bus stop.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、公共の交通機関を使う人達もいるからバス停からあまり遠くないほうがいいね。

conversation.en_sentence: Will we need to pay any penalty for breaking the current lease?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今の賃貸契約を破棄するのに違約金は必要なの？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we will need to pay one month's rent.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、1ヶ月分の賃貸料を払わなきゃいけないんだよね。

conversation.en_sentence: However, that is much less than paying an extra 20 percent every month for the rest of the year.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、20%上乗せされた額を毎月年末まで払うよりは全然安いよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We need to consider security as well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 治安も考慮しなくちゃね。

conversation.en_sentence: What is the safest part of town?
conversation.ja_sentence: どこが街で1番安全な地域かな。

conversation.en_sentence: The westside and eastside are both safe.
conversation.ja_sentence: 西側と東側はどっちも安全だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: What are the benefits of living on the westside?
conversation.ja_sentence: 西側の良い面はなんだろう？

conversation.en_sentence: The real estate prices are lower than the eastside.
conversation.ja_sentence: 不動産が東側よりは安いことかな。

conversation.en_sentence: Conversely, what are the benefits of living on the eastside?
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ逆に、東側の良い面は？

conversation.en_sentence: It is more convenient, and closer to downtown.
conversation.ja_sentence: もっと便利でダウンタウンに近いことだね。

conversation.en_sentence: What side of town do you live on?
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたはどっち側に住んでるの？

conversation.en_sentence: I live on the westside.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は西側だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: How about you?
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたは？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, me too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私もだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I wonder what part of town most of our employees live in.
conversation.ja_sentence: どっちに住んでる従業員が多いんだろうね。

conversation.en_sentence: We should take a poll.
conversation.ja_sentence: 票決を取ったら良いよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you blast an email containing a poll asking what part of town everyone lives in?
conversation.ja_sentence: 街のどちら側に住んでるか、投票のメールを一斉配信してくれる？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、わかった。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you want the choices to be?
conversation.ja_sentence: 選択肢はどうする？

conversation.en_sentence: Let's make them north, south, east, and west.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東西南北で取ろうよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Then, let's start looking at real estate in the area that gets the most votes.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうしたら、1番票が多かった地域で不動産を探そうか。

conversation.en_sentence: Although I know it will be less expensive, I'm going to miss working downtown.
conversation.ja_sentence: だけど、安いのは分かるけどダウンタウンで働くのが恋しくなるなあ。

conversation.en_sentence: Not only is it convenient, it's so much fun!
conversation.ja_sentence: 便利だし、すごく楽しいしね！

conversation.en_sentence: If we move out to the eastside or westside, we can't do as many team lunches or happy hours.
conversation.ja_sentence: 東側か西側に引っ越したら、今までのようにはチームランチやハッピーアワーに行けなくなるね。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope that doesn't bring down morale.
conversation.ja_sentence: みんながやる気を失わないと良いけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, we can certainly look at other properties downtown, and see if there is one for less than what we are paying now.
conversation.ja_sentence: まあ、ダウンタウンの他の不動産も今よりもっと安いところがないかどうか一応見たてみたほうがいいよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Besides, we're just going to collect some data.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうせデータを集めるんだからね。

conversation.en_sentence: It never hurts to look.
conversation.ja_sentence: 調べて損することはないし。

conversation.en_sentence: You're absolutely right.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通り。

conversation.en_sentence: If we find some places we like, we will have to have a big discussion with all of the managers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 気に入ったことろが見つかったら、マネージャー達とよく話し合わないと。

title: Asking for permission to leave early

conversation.en_sentence: Hello Mr. Kato.
conversation.ja_sentence: 加藤さん、こんにちは。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Mr. Toyama.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、遠山君。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope I'm not bothering you by coming to your office without emailing you first.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先にEメールをしないで加藤さんのオフィスに来てしまったのでご迷惑でなければいいのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: It's not a problem at all.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全く問題ないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you want to ask me something?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か聞きたいことでも？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I haven't been feeling well this morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、今日は少し体調が悪くて。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I may be coming down with a cold.
conversation.ja_sentence: 風邪をひき始めているのかもしれないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no that's terrible.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんな、それは大変だ。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you start feeling ill this morning?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今朝から調子が悪いのかい？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I woke up late last night and was coughing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は昨日の夜中に起きたら咳をしていたんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I thought I could still come into work, but I started feeling much worse after arriving.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事には行けるとは思ったのですが着いてからだいぶ体調が悪化してきているんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Would it be ok if I left work early?
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事を早退しても良いですか？

conversation.en_sentence: I understand it isn't easy to work while you are feeling ill.
conversation.ja_sentence: 体調が悪い時に仕事をするのは簡単なことではないよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, it would not be good if others in the office got sick.
conversation.ja_sentence: それに他の人たちが風邪をひいても困るし。

conversation.en_sentence: Right, I really don't want to get everyone sick.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうなんですよね、私も皆さんに風邪をひいてほしくないです。

conversation.en_sentence: So it's ok to go home early today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日は早退してもいいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Please get some rest and email me tomorrow to let me know how you are feeling.
conversation.ja_sentence: ゆっくり休んで明日体調はどうかメールしてね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, I'll email you tomorrow.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、明日メールします。

conversation.en_sentence: That sounds good.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった。

conversation.en_sentence: Just take care of yourself for now.
conversation.ja_sentence: お大事に。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, I hope I can get over this soon.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、すぐ治せるようにします。

conversation.en_sentence: Definitely, go take a rest.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、ゆっくり休んで。

title: Taking time off for an ill family member

conversation.en_sentence: Hi Mr. Williams.
conversation.ja_sentence: ウィリアムズさん、こんにちは。

conversation.en_sentence: Hello Mr. Taylor.
conversation.ja_sentence: こんにちは、テイラーさん。

conversation.en_sentence: I brought you in to talk about your performance over the past two months.
conversation.ja_sentence: 過去２ヶ月の成績について話したくて来てもらいました。

conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, it seems like you've been underperforming compared to your coworkers.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら、他のチームメンバー達と比較してウィリアムズさんの業績が低調です。

conversation.en_sentence: Is everything OK with you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何かありましたか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, everything is fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、特に何もないです。

conversation.en_sentence: However, I have been distracted by some personal issues in my life.
conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、最近個人的な問題があって、集中できないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Actually, my father is in the hospital with heart issues.
conversation.ja_sentence: 実は私の父が心臓に問題があり、入院しているのです。

conversation.en_sentence: This has made it difficult to focus on work lately.
conversation.ja_sentence: そのせいもあり、なかなか仕事に集中できません。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはお気の毒に。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope your father is recovering.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良くなるのを願っています。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: It would be OK if you need to take some time off to be with your family.
conversation.ja_sentence: 家族と過ごすために休みを取りたいのであれば可能ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sympathetic to family concerns.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私は家族のことに関して同情しています。

conversation.en_sentence: However, I need you to come back ready to work.
conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、戻ってくるときには仕事が出来るように準備していただきたいです。

conversation.en_sentence: We have have many important deadlines next month, and I will need you to be focused on work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来月たくさんの締め切りがあって、集中して取り組んでいただきたいので。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your understanding.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご理解いただきありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I think a week off from work would be helpful to clear my mind.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一週間仕事から休みを頂くことで心の整理が出来ると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: No problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題ないです。

conversation.en_sentence: I was going to suggest you to take one week off.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一週間休みを取るよう提案する所でした。

conversation.en_sentence: I understand.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Please spend the time with your family and don’t think about work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 仕事のことは考えず、家族との時間を過ごしてください。

conversation.en_sentence: However I will need you to be ready to work hard when you return.
conversation.ja_sentence: 戻ってきたときには一生懸命働いてくださいね。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, I understand.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです、わかりました。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: No problem Mr. Williams.
conversation.ja_sentence: 問題ないですよ、ウィリアムズさん。

conversation.en_sentence: Also, again, I hope your father makes a fast recovery.
conversation.ja_sentence: あと、繰り返すようだけど、お父さんが早く治るのを願っています。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: I will touch base with you when I return to work again.
conversation.ja_sentence: また仕事に戻れる時に、連絡します。

conversation.en_sentence: Please do.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうして下さい。

conversation.en_sentence: There you are, Ray.
conversation.ja_sentence: レイさん、いたいた。

conversation.en_sentence: Congratulations on your promotion to branch manager!
conversation.ja_sentence: 支店長に昇進、おめでとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうも。

conversation.en_sentence: What's the matter?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: You don't look so thrilled.
conversation.ja_sentence: あまり嬉しそうには、見えないですけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, of course I'm so happy.
conversation.ja_sentence: あぁ、もちろん嬉しいさ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm very honored to be the branch manager.
conversation.ja_sentence: それにとても光栄な事だ。

conversation.en_sentence: But, I have to transfer to Minnesota.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、ミネソタに転勤しないといけないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, to Minnesota?
conversation.ja_sentence: えぇ、ミネソタに？

conversation.en_sentence: That's such a cold place.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても寒いところですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Right?
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだろ？

conversation.en_sentence: You know how much I hate the cold.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は、私がどれだけ寒いのが嫌いか知っているだろ？

conversation.en_sentence: I do but...
conversation.ja_sentence: 知ってますけど・・

conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry about it.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんな事、気になさらないで。

conversation.en_sentence: You'll be fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたなら大丈夫ですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope so.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだといいんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: By the way, we want to celebrate your promotion.
conversation.ja_sentence: そんな事より、私たちはあなたの昇進をお祝いしたいんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We are planning to hold a promotion party for you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 昇進パーティーを計画しているんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's very nice of you.
conversation.ja_sentence: それはご親切に。

conversation.en_sentence: You don't have to though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、そんな事はしなくていいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We want to.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私達はやりたいんです。

conversation.en_sentence: We want to show our appreciation for your hard work.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの一生懸命な仕事ぶりに、感謝を表したいのです。

conversation.en_sentence: You've been a great mentor for us.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたは私達にとって、本当に素晴らしい上司でした。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとう。

conversation.en_sentence: Would next Friday at six o'clock work for you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週の金曜日、６時は大丈夫ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I have nothing planned.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、何も予定はないよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: よかった。

conversation.en_sentence: The party will be held at Room 56.
conversation.ja_sentence: レセプションパーティーはルーム５６で行いますね。

conversation.en_sentence: All of your family is invited.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご家族の方も、いらしてください。

conversation.en_sentence: I've had such a nice team.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は、本当にいいチームを持っていたな。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to miss you guys so much.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても淋しくなるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: We're going to miss you too.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私達も淋しくなります。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you know who's replacing you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 誰があなたの後を引き継ぐか知っていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Robinson from Iowa is taking over my spot.
conversation.ja_sentence: アイオワ州からくるロビンソンさんが引き継ぐよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He is a great guy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼はとってもいい人だよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I hope Mr. Robinson will be as great as you are.
conversation.ja_sentence: ロビンソンさんも、あなたみたいに素晴らしい人だといいんだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: He has big shoes to fill.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたの抜けた穴は、大きいですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He will be just fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼なら大丈夫さ。

conversation.en_sentence: Good Morning, Company A, how may I help you?
conversation.ja_sentence: おはようございます、A社です、どの様なご用件でしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Hello, Could I speak to Mr. Jones please?
conversation.ja_sentence: ジョーンズさんをお願いできますか？

conversation.en_sentence: May I ask who's calling?
conversation.ja_sentence: お名前を頂戴できますか？

conversation.en_sentence: It's Joe Brown with Company B.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私はB社のジョー ブラウンです。

conversation.en_sentence: Could I ask the purpose of the call, please?
conversation.ja_sentence: ご用件をお聞きしてもよろしいですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes of course.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I met Mr. Jones at the IT conference in Las Vegas last week, and he asked for me to call him.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先週ラスベガスで行われたIT会議でジョーンズさんにお会いしまして、電話をする様に言われたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: He's away from his desk at the moment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今は離席しておりますね。

conversation.en_sentence: When would be a convenient time for me to call back?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何時頃お電話したらよろしいでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not really sure Mr. Brown.
conversation.ja_sentence: はっきりは分かりません、ブラウンさん。

conversation.en_sentence: You might want to try calling back tomorrow morning.
conversation.ja_sentence: 明日の朝掛け直してみていただくか。

conversation.en_sentence: Or, I can take a message and have him call you back.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしくは、私が御伝言を承って、ジョーンズの方から掛け直させますが。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, so as I said before, we met at the IT conference and he had asked for me to reach out and schedule a time when I could do an online demonstration of our CRM.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします、先程申し上げた通り、IT会議でお会いして、我が社のCRMについてのオンラインデモの予定を決めるために電話する様に言われましたので。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm sorry, but you're cutting out.
conversation.ja_sentence: すみません、お電話が途切れてしまっているのですが。

conversation.en_sentence: I think our phone lines may be acting up.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらの電話回線に異常があるのかもしれません。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you hear me?
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞こえますか？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes I can hear you fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、ちゃんと聞こえますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Could you please repeat the message?
conversation.ja_sentence: もう1度御伝言をお願いできますか？

conversation.en_sentence: He asked for me to reach out and schedule a time when I could do an online demonstration of our CRM.
conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社のCRMについてのオンラインデモの予定を決めるために電話する様にジョーンズさんに言われました。

conversation.en_sentence: Absolutely Mr. Brown.
conversation.ja_sentence: かしこまりました、ブラウンさん。

conversation.en_sentence: What is a good number to reach you at?
conversation.ja_sentence: お電話番号をいただけますか？

conversation.en_sentence: He can call me on my cell, it's XXXXXX-XXXX.
conversation.ja_sentence: 携帯電話になります、番号はXXXXXX-XXXXです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'll give him the message as soon as I see him.
conversation.ja_sentence: ではジョーンズと連絡がつき次第伝えておきます。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for your help.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: How can I play this video on the monitor?
conversation.ja_sentence: この動画をモニターに映すにはどうしたらいいの？

conversation.en_sentence: Select input one.
conversation.ja_sentence: インプット1を選択して。

conversation.en_sentence: Then push the big circular button on the remote control.
conversation.ja_sentence: それからリモコンの大きい丸いボタンを押して。

conversation.en_sentence: OK, now I'm at the home screen.
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、今ホームスクリーンになったけど。

conversation.en_sentence: What do I do?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたらいい？

conversation.en_sentence: Push the down cursor and scroll through the applications.
conversation.ja_sentence: カーソルを下方向に押して、アプリケーションをスクロールしていって。

conversation.en_sentence: Then select YouTube.
conversation.ja_sentence: ユーチューブを選んで。

conversation.en_sentence: Then search for the video you want to play on the monitor.

conversation.en_sentence: For example, I can record a video on my smartphone and share it with the world in real time.

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah it really is amazing what we are capable of these days.

conversation.en_sentence: 20 years ago if I wanted to share a video it would have been a lot of work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 20年前はビデオを誰かに見せるなんて大変な作業だったからね。

conversation.en_sentence: First, I would have had to record it on to video recorder.

conversation.en_sentence: What do you think are some of the disadvantages of technology being so advanced?

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の携帯アプリは今、グーグルプレイストアやアップストアからダウンロードできるようになっています。

conversation.en_sentence: Since this application is still new and I think it needs much improvement, I would like everyone here to download it and give a feedback.
conversation.ja_sentence: このアプリはまだ新しく、多くの改善が必要だと思いますので、皆さんにもダウンロードしてもらって、フィードバックをいただきたいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Before we launch this mobile application to the public and broadcast the information to all of our client, I would like to receive feedback from our employees first.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一般公開とクライアント向けの情報公開前に、当社の社員からのフィードバックが欲しいのです。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, it's great to know that finally our mobile application can be used.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった、うちの携帯アプリがついに使えるようになったと知って嬉しいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Please broadcast the information to all of our employees and push them to use the mobile application and give feedback.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全社員に知らせて、アプリを使ってフィードバックを送るように積極的に呼びかけてくれ。

conversation.en_sentence: It will be good if we can launch this application before the end of the year.
conversation.ja_sentence: 年末までに、このアプリをリリースできれば上出来だ。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will broadcast the information after this meeting.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、このミーティングの後に皆に知らせます。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay.
conversation.ja_sentence: お願いします。

conversation.en_sentence: Guys, I'm not really happy with our current supplier of machined parts, can you recommend anyone else?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕は今の機械パーツサプライヤーあまり好きじゃないな、どこか他にいいのを知らない？

conversation.en_sentence: Why, what's wrong with the current one?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうしてだい、今の会社の何が不満なんだ？

conversation.en_sentence: I feel the quality has dropped a lot recently, and we're often made to wait on orders.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近品質がぐっと下がったみたいだし、そのくせ入荷まで結構待たされるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I agree.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕も同感だ。

conversation.en_sentence: What do you think has changed?
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は何が変わったと思う？

conversation.en_sentence: They've expanded into such a large operation they can no longer cater to the requests of small companies like ours.
conversation.ja_sentence: 事業拡大の結果うちみたいな小企業の要望には応じられない体制になってしまったみたいだな。

conversation.en_sentence: Exactly, though we require high-precision parts, we only need them in a small volume each time, so I feel bigger orders are given priority over us.
conversation.ja_sentence: その通りなんだ、我々は高精度部品を求めているものの毎回小口注文だから、我々より大口注文の方を優先しているようだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I think they squeeze us in between bigger orders, and they don't have time to set up the machines properly.
conversation.ja_sentence: うちの注文は大口注文の間に入れ込んでいるから、マシンをちゃんとセットアップする時間がないんだと思う。

conversation.en_sentence: Leading to less precision and delays, I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: その結果、精度は落ちて待ちは長くなる、か。

conversation.en_sentence: There is one place I read about recently that could be promising.
conversation.ja_sentence: 最近記事で読んだところなんだが、もしかしてあそこはいけるかもしれない。

conversation.en_sentence: Where's that?
conversation.ja_sentence: どこだい？

conversation.en_sentence: They're called P Machining, and they sound pretty innovative.
conversation.ja_sentence: P加工社といって、結構画期的だったと思うよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I've heard of them, they use a lot of automation, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: その会社聞いたことあるような気がするな、オートメーションが多いんだよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, and they specialize in manufacturing low volume, high-quality parts with quick turnaround times.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、小口の高品質パーツの製造が専門で、納期が短いんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Plus, they have a web interface, so you can upload your CAD file and get an instant quote.
conversation.ja_sentence: おまけにウェブ上でCADファイルをアップロードすれば即見積してくれる。

conversation.en_sentence: You can also track the production and shipping of parts online.
conversation.ja_sentence: 部品の製造から発送までオンラインで追跡もできるんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: That all sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 素晴らしいな。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm intrigued, but I guess I'm a bit old-fashioned.
conversation.ja_sentence: 興味をそそられるんだけど、僕ちょっとついていけそうにないかもしれない。

conversation.en_sentence: I'd prefer to visit them in person and check out their equipment before making an order through a faceless computer screen.
conversation.ja_sentence: PCのスクリーンで無人注文するよりも、実際に担当者に会って装置など確認してから注文する方がしっくりくるな。

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I'll see if I can find that article I read.
conversation.ja_sentence: うーん、その記事探せるか見てみるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: It had their contact details on, so I can look about setting that up.
conversation.ja_sentence: 連絡先もあったはずだから、アポ取れるかやってみるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thanks Christian.
conversation.ja_sentence: クリスチャン、ありがとう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Can I ask you for a favor?
conversation.ja_sentence: ちょっとお願いがあるんだが。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to Brazil next week for a business trip.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週ブラジル出張なんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: But I'm actually not familiar with Brazil.
conversation.ja_sentence: だが、正直ブラジルについてはよく知らなくてね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Do you think you can gather some materials on Brazil?
conversation.ja_sentence: ブラジルに関する資料を少々集めてくれないかな？

conversation.en_sentence: What kind of material are you looking for?
conversation.ja_sentence: どんな資料をご希望ですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Well the business partner in Brazil is in the forest industry so information on that would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだな、ブラジルの事業パートナーは林業関係だから、その情報があると有難いんだが。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, so the forest industry in Brazil.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました、ブラジルの林業ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Do you want information like number of sawmills, and harvest data?
conversation.ja_sentence: 製材所の数とか伐採量なんかの情報はいりますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Can you also find out what their logging regulations are as well?
conversation.ja_sentence: あっちの伐採規則がどうなっているかもわかるかな？

conversation.en_sentence: I think so.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: What's the purpose of your meeting again?
conversation.ja_sentence: ミーティングの目的は何でしたっけ？

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I'm going to see if we should invest in their sawmill.
conversation.ja_sentence: 向こうの製材所に投資すべきか判断するんだ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: They produce lumber for the Chinese and European market.
conversation.ja_sentence: 先方は中国と欧州市場向けに木材を製造している。

conversation.en_sentence: I guess I should also look up where the port is and the trade data?
conversation.ja_sentence: でしたら、港の所在地と貿易データも調べておいたほうがいいですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: That would be great.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは助かるな。

conversation.en_sentence: I can probably find the trade data from Brazil's government website.
conversation.ja_sentence: たぶん、ブラジル政府のサイトから貿易データが取れると思います。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: How long do you think it will take?
conversation.ja_sentence: どれくらいかかりそう？

conversation.en_sentence: I think I can get it done by the time you leave for your business trip.
conversation.ja_sentence: 出張にご出発される頃までには完成すると思いますよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, that's fine.
conversation.ja_sentence: わかった、それでいい。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I can read it on the plane.
conversation.ja_sentence: 飛行機の中で読めるな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: It's going to be a long flight.
conversation.ja_sentence: 長いフライトになるからね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ブルース 中島さん
conversation.en_sentence: I have to transfer once in Houston.
conversation.ja_sentence: ヒューストンで一旦乗り換えないといけないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Good luck on your trip!
conversation.ja_sentence: 道中お気をつけて。

conversation.en_sentence: You want me to take on more responsibility?
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕にこれ以上責任を負えというんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, you are not thinking...
conversation.ja_sentence: いやいや、そんな考えあなたが...

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I think you are perfect for the position.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうだ、君にぴったりの役職だと思うんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm not just talking about Multinational team, I'm talking about the entire Sales Group.
conversation.ja_sentence: 多国籍チームだけの話じゃない、営業グループ全体について言ってるんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: This may be a good opportunity to restructure the Sales Group.
conversation.ja_sentence: 営業チームを再構築するのにこれは良い機会になる。

conversation.en_sentence: So although I was initially thinking just team leaders and abolishing group manager, maybe we should have an experienced group manager after all so team leader positions could be given to more recent hires.
conversation.ja_sentence: 始めはチームリーダーだけにしてグループマネージャーを廃止しようと考えてたんだが、チームリーダーの役割を新しい社員に任せられるよう、やはり経験豊富なグループマネージャーがいるべきかもしれない。

conversation.en_sentence: So, you mean you want me to fill Mari's position?
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり、私に真理の仕事をしてくれということですか？

conversation.en_sentence: You basically take over her entire package.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女のパッケージをそのまま引き継ぐんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Pay, benefits, the whole nine yards, so to speak.
conversation.ja_sentence: 給料、待遇、言ってみれば、何もかもだ。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm flattered that you use American colloquialism, but don't you think Eugina is more of an appropriate choice?
conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカ的な口語表現を使っていただき恐縮ですが、ユージーナがよりふさわしい選択肢だと思いませんか？

conversation.en_sentence: Just hire someone new for Global Relations and Eugina can manage Sales.
conversation.ja_sentence: グローバル・リレーションズに誰か新しく雇えば、ユージーナで営業を管理できますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I mean she has an MBA from an Ivy League and at least a decade of management experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女はアイビーリーグのMBAを持っていて、少なくとも10年のマネジメント経験がありますから。

conversation.en_sentence: First and foremost, she doesn't want any more responsibilities.
conversation.ja_sentence: まずは何よりもね、彼女はこれ以上の責任を負いたくないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: She has made that clear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それははっきりと言われた。

conversation.en_sentence: You know her family situation, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女の家庭状況、知ってるよな？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, she told me she has a special needs son.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、特別援助が必要な息子さんがいるって聞きました。

conversation.en_sentence: She really wants to focus on her family right now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今はとにかく家族を大切にしたいんだよ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's why she doesn't work full time.
conversation.ja_sentence: それでフルタイムで働かないんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: Second of all, it's about time you're rewarded for your work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 二つ目にはね、そろそろ君の仕事が評価される時期だろ。

conversation.en_sentence: You know I'm a college dropout.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕がカレッジの中退者だとご存じですよね。

conversation.en_sentence: You mention that often.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はそれをよく口にするよね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I don't even know how I ended up being hired.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、どうして僕が雇われることになったかすら分かりません。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm finding out everyone else here is an ivy leaguer.
conversation.ja_sentence: ここでは僕以外全員がアイビーリーグ出身者だと知って。

conversation.en_sentence: Mari, John, Eugina, Taichi, Won Bin, Yumi, all of our scientists, not to mention our management, and Kate!
conversation.ja_sentence: 真理、ジョン、ユージーナ、ウォン・ビン、由美、科学者全員、うちの経営陣は言うまでもないですが、ケイトも！

conversation.en_sentence: Jesus, she was Harvard Summa cum laude!
conversation.ja_sentence: ビックリですよ、彼女はハーバードの最優秀生だったんですよ！

conversation.en_sentence: Not so, I went to Cambridge.
conversation.ja_sentence: 残念、僕はケンブリッジ卒だ。

conversation.en_sentence: Can you just not rub it in.
conversation.ja_sentence: もう言わないでもらえます？

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko loves people who graduated high caliber schools.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長は優秀校の卒業生が大好きなんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: She thinks it's an indication of something.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが何か意味あることだと思ってるのさ。

conversation.en_sentence: To me it's an indication of nothing.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕にとっては何の意味もないけどね。

conversation.en_sentence: All I care about is results.
conversation.ja_sentence: 大切なのは結果のみだ。

conversation.en_sentence: You have built up the Small Cap group all by yourself.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君はスモールキャップグループを一人で立ち上げてきた。

conversation.en_sentence: You have enough experience.
conversation.ja_sentence: 経験は十分にある。

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko's going to block it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 社長が反対しますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Keiko thinks highly of you and this one is my decision.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼女は君を高く評価してるし、これは僕の決断だ。

conversation.en_sentence: All I have to do is have Sylvester's approval and I'm confident I can get this through.
conversation.ja_sentence: 必要なのはシルベスターの承諾だけだし、僕にはこれを押し切る自信がある。

conversation.en_sentence: So are you in?
conversation.ja_sentence: で、やってみるかい？

conversation.en_sentence: I am very honored to be here.
conversation.ja_sentence: 呼んでいただけてとても光栄です。

conversation.en_sentence: The pleasure is all mine.
conversation.ja_sentence: こちらこそ。

conversation.en_sentence: I have read some of your papers you have submitted with your resume.
conversation.ja_sentence: 履歴書と一緒に提出していただいた書類に目を通しました。

conversation.en_sentence: It was very impressive.
conversation.ja_sentence: とても素晴らしかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.
conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。

conversation.ja_speaker: シルベスター コー
conversation.en_sentence: So you have had your own company for a while?
conversation.ja_sentence: それで、しばらくご自分の会社をお持ちだったんですね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, Mr. Ko.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、コーさん。

conversation.en_sentence: Although I think "company" is an overstatement.
conversation.ja_sentence: 「会社」というのは大げさだとは思いますが。

conversation.en_sentence: It was a one man operation.
conversation.ja_sentence: 1人で経営してたんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I was basically just making one lens after another, and submitting patents.
conversation.ja_sentence: 基本的には、ただレンズを一つ一つ作り、特許を出願していました。

conversation.en_sentence: Your resume is very interesting.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君の履歴書はとても興味深い。

conversation.en_sentence: You received your PhD 8 years after you set up your own company.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご自分の会社を立ち上げた８年後に博士号を取得していますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, well, engineers don't tend to go for PhDs.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、まあ通常エンジニアは博士号まで目指しませんから。

conversation.en_sentence: We are content with a masters.
conversation.ja_sentence: 修士号で満足するんです。

conversation.en_sentence: But I did a lot of work with universities and I was close with one doctoral advisor.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも私は大学関係の仕事が多くて、博士課程の指導教員の一人と仲が良かったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: He advised me I might as well do a PhD since the work I was doing was equivalent to what I would do in a PhD program.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私がしている仕事はPhDプログラムでやるのと同等だから、博士号を取得したほうがいいって、彼がアドバイスしてくれたんです。

conversation.en_sentence: Basically all I had to do was submit a dissertation and defend it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 要するに、ただ論文を提出しそれを証明すれば良かったんです。

conversation.ja_speaker: シルベスター コー
conversation.en_sentence: How many patents do you have?
conversation.ja_sentence: 特許はいくつ持っているんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: About 110.
conversation.ja_sentence: 約110個です。

conversation.ja_speaker: シルベスター コー
conversation.en_sentence: That is a lot!
conversation.ja_sentence: それは多い！

conversation.en_sentence: That's really impressive.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本当に素晴らしい。

conversation.en_sentence: How have you monetized that?
conversation.ja_sentence: どうやってそれを収益化したんですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, that's the problem.
conversation.ja_sentence: いや、それが問題でして。

conversation.en_sentence: I had about 200 patents so far, but I had to sell nearly half of them.
conversation.ja_sentence: それまで200ほど特許があったんですが、半分近くを売らなければなりませんでした。

conversation.en_sentence: At the end of the day, lens alone won't get me anywhere, unfortunately.
conversation.ja_sentence: 結局、レンズ単体ではどうにもならないんですよ、残念ながら。

conversation.en_sentence: It's always used with something else, and if that something else is made by a large corporation, they basically take advantage of the fact that they have more power.
conversation.ja_sentence: レンズは必ず何か他のものと使われますし、その何かが大企業によって生産されていれば、結局はより力があるという事実を企業が上手く利用しますよね。

conversation.en_sentence: They know I need their business more than they need me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 彼らが私を必要とする以上に、私が彼らのビジネスを必要としてるって分かっているんですよ。

conversation.en_sentence: So they force you to sell your patent?
conversation.ja_sentence: つまり企業に特許を無理やり売らされる？

conversation.en_sentence: It's that at a cheap price or "not interested".
conversation.ja_sentence: 安い値段で売るか、そうでなければ「興味ありません」ってわけです。

conversation.en_sentence: Are you compensated well enough in any way for your discovery?
conversation.ja_sentence: ご自分の発見には何らかの形で十分に対価を得ていますか？

conversation.en_sentence: From my point of view, no.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の見解では、いいえ、です。

conversation.en_sentence: And that is why I have decided that just doing this myself is fruitless.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですからそれが理由で、自分1人でやっているだけでは無益だと決断したんです。

conversation.en_sentence: It's better to work with others to create something bigger.
conversation.ja_sentence: より大きなものを作るには他者と働くほうが良いと。

conversation.en_sentence: But I don't want to be a cog in a big corporation.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも私は大企業で歯車にはなりたくはないんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to work somewhere that will appreciate my specialty and will able to utilize to the full extent what I make.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私の専門性を評価し、私が作るものを最大限に活用してくれる場所で働きたかったんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I think you have come to the right place.
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたはぴったりな場所に来られたと思いますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Do we have any policy on working from home?
conversation.ja_sentence: 我社には在宅勤務方針ってありますか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Like telecommuting?
conversation.ja_sentence: テレコミューティングみたいな？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい。

conversation.en_sentence: I think the snow is going to be pretty bad next week so I was wondering if I can work from home if I'm snowed in.
conversation.ja_sentence: 来週はひどい雪になると思うんで、大雪で閉じ込められたら家から仕事できないかと考えています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Good point.
conversation.ja_sentence: 良いこと言うね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: You have a company laptop and phone so you can technically work from home.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君は社用ラップトップと携帯を持ってるし、技術的には在宅勤務できるな。

conversation.en_sentence: I think I will be more productive too.
conversation.ja_sentence: その方が生産性も上がるかと思うんです。

conversation.en_sentence: I'm the type that feels more comfortable working at home.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕、家で仕事した方がリラックスできるタイプなんですよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I think we're all that type.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆、そのタイプなんじゃないかな。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Let me go check with the administration department on the company policy.
conversation.ja_sentence: 総務部に行って会社の方針について確認してくるよ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: I know we usually don't allow working from home on normal conditions.
conversation.ja_sentence: 本来なら在宅勤務は許可されていないはずだから。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: But it can't be helped if you're snowed in.
conversation.ja_sentence: だが、雪に閉じ込められたら仕方ないからね。

conversation.en_sentence: Great, thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: 助かります、どうも。

conversation.en_sentence: Let me know what they say.
conversation.ja_sentence: 総務が何て言うか知らせてください。

conversation.ja_speaker: ベン シャーマンさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, I will.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうするよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright guys, we only have twenty five minutes scheduled for today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんいいですか、今日は25分しか時間をとっていないので。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's try our best to finish up early.
conversation.ja_sentence: 早く終わらせるように最善を尽くしましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: It will be fairly quick, I think.
conversation.ja_sentence: かなり早く終わると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Did you guys already talk about it?
conversation.ja_sentence: あなたたち、もうあれについて話したの？

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, we talked about it briefly.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、さらっとですが話しました。

conversation.en_sentence: That will make things easier.
conversation.ja_sentence: じゃ、話は簡単ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: As you know, this year we will take a longer trip.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご存知のように、今年から私たちの旅行は長めになります。

conversation.en_sentence: Please let me know who can't make it from each team as soon as possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 各チームで参加できないのは誰か、出来るだけ早く教えてください。

conversation.en_sentence: Nobody likes last minute changes if it's about a trip.
conversation.ja_sentence: 旅行に関して、ぎりぎりでの変更を好む人はいませんから。

conversation.en_sentence: Is this company trip mandatory for everyone?
conversation.ja_sentence: この社員旅行は全員強制参加なんでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Not really.
conversation.ja_sentence: そうでもないです。

conversation.en_sentence: But, of course, it will be kind of an important trip for newcomers.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、もちろん新入りにとっては大切な旅行とも言えます。

conversation.en_sentence: Lots of other teams say they want to try somewhere totally new this time.
conversation.ja_sentence: 他のチームの多くが、今回は全く新しい場所を試してみたいと言ってますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: I know it sounds great, but if we do decide to go to somewhere new, someone has to prepare a lot before we go.
conversation.ja_sentence: 聞こえがいいのはわかりますが、もし新しい所に行くと決めたら、行く前に誰かがたくさんの準備をしないといけません。

conversation.en_sentence: We narrowed it down to Asia, right?
conversation.ja_sentence: アジアに絞ったんですよね？

conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we just have to decide on which country we want to visit.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、訪問したい国を決めないといけないだけです。

conversation.en_sentence: How about combining two countries this time?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は二国一緒にというのはどうでしょうか？

conversation.en_sentence: Will that be too much, do you think?
conversation.ja_sentence: 欲張り過ぎだと思いますか？

conversation.en_sentence: We have twelve days this time, so if the countries are close enough, it's possible.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回は12日あるので、国同士が近ければ可能です。

conversation.en_sentence: I think China and Korea might work.
conversation.ja_sentence: 中国と韓国ならいけると思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Or Japan and China?
conversation.ja_sentence: または、日本と韓国？

conversation.en_sentence: Personally I would love to go to Thailand if we can.
conversation.ja_sentence: 個人的には、できるならタイに行きたいですけど。

conversation.en_sentence: If we want to try two countries this time, Thailand might be a bit tricky.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今回、二国にしてみるなら、タイはちょっと微妙ですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Are we visiting some of our branches during this trip?
conversation.ja_sentence: この旅行中に、うちの支社のいくつかを訪れる予定ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Well, I might have to, but not you guys.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっと、私はそうしないといけないかも知れないですが、あなたたちはいいわよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Don't worry about that part.
conversation.ja_sentence: そこは心配しないでください。

conversation.en_sentence: That's good to know, though.
conversation.ja_sentence: でも、知っておいたほうがいいですが。

conversation.en_sentence: Japan and Korea or Thailand and Vietnam will work for sure.
conversation.ja_sentence: 日本と韓国、またはタイとベトナム、なら絶対いけますね。

conversation.en_sentence: Let's put that plan to a vote.
conversation.ja_sentence: その計画で、投票することにしましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Make sure that we take other suggestions, too, just in case.
conversation.ja_sentence: 念のために、他の提案も受け付けるようにしましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, that sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かりました、いいと思います。

conversation.en_sentence: I can send out the voting form through our company app today.
conversation.ja_sentence: 今日中に、社内アプリで投票フォームを送れますよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Oh, that will be very helpful.
conversation.ja_sentence: あら、それはとっても助かります。

conversation.en_sentence: Once we decide, we will talk about all the details later this month.
conversation.ja_sentence: 一旦決めたら、今月中に細かいことを話しましょう。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure, during our lunch time?
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、ランチ時間にですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Sounds perfect.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいですね。

conversation.en_sentence: Yep, I think we're ready to go.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、じゃ、これでいいでしょう。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Hello there, my name is Henry Clements from Company A.
conversation.ja_sentence: もしもし、A社のヘンリー クレメンツと申します。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to reach out, because we've been helping staffing agencies like yours find exceptional candidates.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当社は御社のような人材派遣会社様が優秀な人材を探すのをお手伝いしておりまして、ご連絡させていただきました。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: I had a look through your job postings and thought we can maybe collaborate in sharing our candidate pool.
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社の求人情報を拝見させていただいたところ、当社の登録求職者とシェアすることで提携できるのではないかと思いまして。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: What kind of idea do you have in mind?
conversation.ja_sentence: どのような案をお考えですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Well, since your agency focuses a lot on the IT sector, I was thinking of pooling our candidates together to find suitable candidates for more job posts.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、御社はITセクターに非常に力を入れておられるので、当社の登録求職者と一緒にシェアしましたら、より多くの求人に適材を探し出せるのではと思うのですが。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: How would we share the profits?
conversation.ja_sentence: 収益はどのようにシェアするのですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Say if we filled your job post with someone in our pool, we would get 75 percent of the commission and you get 25 percent.
conversation.ja_sentence: 例えば、御社の求人に当社の登録者が採用された場合、当社は75パーセントの手数料、御社は25パーセントを受け取ります。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: And vice versa.
conversation.ja_sentence: 逆の場合は逆の割合で。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry I'm not too familiar with your agency.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼ですが、そちらの代理店についてはよく存じておりません。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Our agency is actually similar to yours.
conversation.ja_sentence: 当社は御社とよく似ています。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: We focus on the IT sector as well and some of our clients are Company B and Company C.
conversation.ja_sentence: 私共もITセクターに重点をおいておりまして、クライアントにはB社やC社が含まれております。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: We've also been working with Company D for over ten years.
conversation.ja_sentence: D社とも10年以上お取引させていただいております。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, is that right.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうなんですか。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes so I am certain that our pool of candidates would suit your needs.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ですので当社の登録者も御社のニーズに合致しているはずです。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Where are you guys located?
conversation.ja_sentence: 御社はどちらにあるんですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: We are just a couple blocks from your office.
conversation.ja_sentence: そちらのオフィスから数ブロック先です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Oh really.
conversation.ja_sentence: えっ、そうなんですね。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe we should have a face-to-face meeting to discuss this?
conversation.ja_sentence: では直接お会いして、この件をご相談しましょうか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, that would be good.
conversation.ja_sentence: ええ、そうしていただければ。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: When would be a good time for you?
conversation.ja_sentence: いつがご都合よろしいですか？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: How does this Friday sound?
conversation.ja_sentence: 今週の金曜日はいかがでしょう？

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Maybe around 2 o'clock?
conversation.ja_sentence: 2時頃では？

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Yes that sounds great.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、大丈夫です。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: I will look forward to meeting you on Friday then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では、金曜日にお会いできるのを楽しみにしております。

conversation.ja_speaker: ヘンリー クレメンツさん
conversation.en_sentence: Have a good one then.
conversation.ja_sentence: では良い一日を。

conversation.ja_speaker: ジョシュア ティムズさん
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.
conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼します。

conversation.en_sentence: Hi John, are you still available for our meeting today?
conversation.ja_sentence: やあジョン、今日の面談だけど予定は大丈夫ですか？

conversation.en_sentence: Of course, I booked the meeting room number 5 from 3.
conversation.ja_sentence: もちろん、3時から5番の会議室を取ってあるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Ah great, thanks!
conversation.ja_sentence: 良かった、ありがとうございます！

conversation.en_sentence: We've still got about 15 minutes but the room looks available.
conversation.ja_sentence: まだあと15分ぐらいあるけど、部屋はもう空いてるみたい。

conversation.en_sentence: Shall we start early?
conversation.ja_sentence: 早めに始める？

conversation.en_sentence: I mean, only if you are ok with that.
conversation.ja_sentence: もし君が良ければだけど。

conversation.en_sentence: Sure!
conversation.ja_sentence: はい！

conversation.en_sentence: Ok great, I will grab the file.
conversation.ja_sentence: よし、じゃあファイル取ってくるね。

conversation.en_sentence: Here it is, let's go!
conversation.ja_sentence: あった、じゃあ行こうか！

conversation.en_sentence: Super!
conversation.ja_sentence: やった！

conversation.en_sentence: Okay, so, first things first, are you having a good time working here?
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、まず初めに、楽しんで働けてる？

conversation.en_sentence: Is there anything that's concerning you?
conversation.ja_sentence: 何か困ってる事はない？

conversation.en_sentence: Oh no, everything is going very well.
conversation.ja_sentence: 全然、すごくうまくいっています！

conversation.en_sentence: I really appreciate the support everyone has been giving me.
conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さんに助けていただいて本当に感謝しています。

conversation.en_sentence: It's only been a month since I started working in the department but I feel very welcomed and valued.
conversation.ja_sentence: この部署で働き始めてまだ1か月ですが、温かく迎え入れていただいて、尊重されていると感じます。

conversation.en_sentence: It's great.
conversation.ja_sentence: すごくいい環境です。

conversation.en_sentence: Ah, good to hear that.
conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、それは良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, so I had a look at your feedback sheet, and you have mentioned that there were some times that you had to manage some difficult situation.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、もらったフィードバックを見てみたけど、難しいシチュエーションに対応しないといけない事が何回かあった、と書いているね。

conversation.en_sentence: Can I ask you about it?
conversation.ja_sentence: これについて聞いてもいいかな？

conversation.en_sentence: Ah yes, there were some issues with the production line and I was communicating with the factory.
conversation.ja_sentence: はい、製造ラインに問題が起きて、それで工場と連絡を取っていました。

conversation.en_sentence: The manager there was quite frustrated with the situation and I felt a little overwhelmed.
conversation.ja_sentence: あちらのマネージャーがかなり苛立っていたので、それで少し気圧されてしまったところがあって。

conversation.en_sentence: Especially because I still have a lot to learn about our products, I feel like I made the situation more complex than it needed to be.
conversation.ja_sentence: 自社製品についてまだまだ知識が足りていないので、そのせいで事を余計にややこしくしてしまったんじゃないかと思っていました。

conversation.en_sentence: But Julia was there for me whenever I needed to ask her about things, so that was a great help.
conversation.ja_sentence: ですがジュリアがいつでも質問に答えてくれたので、助かりました。

conversation.en_sentence: I see.
conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。

conversation.en_sentence: It does take a little while to get used to it but I am pretty sure you will get there quite quickly.
conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに慣れるまで少し時間はかかると思うけど、君ならすぐにできるようになるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: In the previous department I was just dealing with the numbers so everything is new to me, but I am enjoying it.
conversation.ja_sentence: 前の部署では数字だけ相手にしていたので、全てが新しい経験ですが、楽しんでやれています。

conversation.en_sentence: Good to hear.
conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かった。

conversation.en_sentence: It takes a lot of courage to change your career path but I am happy that you are enjoying the new environment.
conversation.ja_sentence: 途中で専門分野を変えるのはかなり勇気がいる事だと思うけど、新しい環境を楽しめているみたいで僕も嬉しいよ。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, that's very kind of you.
conversation.ja_sentence: ご親切にありがとうございます。

conversation.en_sentence: Product development has always been my dream, so I was over the moon when I could grab this chance.
conversation.ja_sentence: 商品開発は長年の夢だったので、チャンスが巡ってきた時にはものすごくうれしかったです。

conversation.en_sentence: Yeah, Mark told me.
conversation.ja_sentence: うん、マークから聞いてるよ。

conversation.en_sentence: He is very happy with your work by the way.
conversation.ja_sentence: 君の仕事ぶりにとても満足してると言ってたよ。

conversation.en_sentence: As an HR, it's always great to hear from people working happily together.
conversation.ja_sentence: 人事部の人間としては、皆が満足して共に仕事をしている様子を聞くのはいつだって嬉しいんだ。

conversation.en_sentence: That's the best thing for our company to grow and stay healthy.
conversation.ja_sentence: それが、会社が健やかに成長するために一番いい事だからね。

conversation.en_sentence: I agree.
conversation.ja_sentence: 僕もそう思います。

conversation.en_sentence: Ok, is there anything else you would like to talk to me about?
conversation.ja_sentence: オッケー、他に何か話しておきたい事はあるかな？

conversation.en_sentence: No, I'm ok.
conversation.ja_sentence: いいえ、大丈夫です。

conversation.en_sentence: Alright, well call me, email me, talk to me anytime if you need anything, ok?
conversation.ja_sentence: 分かった、まあ何かあれば電話でもメールでも、いつでも連絡してね。

conversation.en_sentence: Thank you, I will!
conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます、そうさせていただきます。
全員揃ったようなので、マネージャーミーティングを始めます。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems that everybody is here, let's begin this manager meeting.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最初に管理部から連絡、周知事項をお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: First of all, I need the administration to tell us what's new and what's known.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、まず年末の年賀状作成についてです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I would like to start with new year's greeting cards, which should be made by the end of the year.

conversation.ja_sentence: 例年通り、会社名で送ります。
conversation.en_sentence: As usual, we will put down our company's address as the sender.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのため、宛先チェックを各担当にお願いすることになります。
conversation.en_sentence: Therefore, I will need each person to check if the addresses were correct.

conversation.ja_sentence: イントラネット上の顧客データベースを元に発送します。
conversation.en_sentence: We will send the cards based on our client database on the intranet.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宛先の会社所在地や先様の社名、肩書などに相違ないかを確認していただきます。
conversation.en_sentence: The company addresses, the names, and the titles should be checked to make sure there is no mistake.

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆さん、顧客データベースは都度情報更新されていると思います。
conversation.en_sentence: You know the client database gets updated each time.

conversation.ja_sentence: ただ、毎年のように、宛先不明等で結構な数が戻ってきていますので注意してください。
conversation.en_sentence: We need to pay extra attention since we get quite a few cards back every year with unknown addresses.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、担当者別に顧客データが最新のものかを確認すればいいわけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Then does each person need to check to see if the client data is correctly updated?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、必要になるのは先ほど言ったとおり、会社所在地と所属部署、役職、お名前となりますが。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, as I mentioned earlier, I need the company addresses, the departments, the titles, and the names.

conversation.ja_sentence: 年に１回のことですし、一度すべて見直してみるいい機会かと。
conversation.en_sentence: Since it's only once a year, this will be a good opportunity to check everything.

conversation.ja_sentence: また、データベースには載っているけど、年賀状が不要という方については、不要欄にチェックをつけてください。
conversation.en_sentence: Also, mark unnecessary for those who do not wish to receive the cards even though they are in the database.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつまで？
conversation.en_sentence: When do you need them done?

conversation.ja_sentence: 必要な枚数も同時に確認したいので、１２月１日金曜日の午後５時までに完了してください。
conversation.en_sentence: By 5pm on Friday January first since I need to confirm the numbers we need at the same time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 年賀状を出す出さないの判断は担当者ベースで？
conversation.en_sentence: Does each person decides who to send the card or not to?

conversation.ja_sentence: それは所属部門で決めていただければ大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: I am okay letting each department make its own decision.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらとしては、締め切り時のデータで準備を進めますので。
conversation.en_sentence: I am going to go with the data I will have at the time of the deadline.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宛先印刷も発送も全部業者に丸投げするんだっけ？
conversation.en_sentence: Are we getting the printing company to do all the address printing and the shipping?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうです。
conversation.en_sentence: That's correct.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一筆書きたくても、一度も現物は手元にこないんだよね？
conversation.en_sentence: We won't see the cards ourselves even though I want to personally write down a message, right?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ですので、もしご自分で宛先等を書くのであれば、宛先空欄の葉書を渡します。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but I can give you the ones with blank address if you wish you put down addresses yourself.

conversation.ja_sentence: その場合、データベース上は不要のチェックをしてください。
conversation.en_sentence: In that case, you need to mark unnecessary for those companies in the database.

conversation.ja_sentence: その上で、必要枚数を直接私宛にメールでご連絡ください。
conversation.en_sentence: And then send me an email to let me know how many you will need.

conversation.ja_sentence: 宛先空欄の葉書はいつ納品される？
conversation.en_sentence: When do I receive the cards with blank addresses?

conversation.ja_sentence: 予定では、１２月１５日納品予定です。
conversation.en_sentence: According to the schedule, they should be delivered by December 15th.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。
conversation.en_sentence: I got it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他に質問ありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Any more questions?

conversation.ja_sentence: 個別に連絡してもらえればできるだけ対応しますので、よろしくお願いします。
conversation.en_sentence: I will be able to assist you as much as I can if you contact me personally, so please feel free to do so.

conversation.ja_sentence: 管理部からは以上でいいかな？
conversation.en_sentence: Is that everything from the administration?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

title: 新入社員歓迎会について

conversation.ja_sentence: そろそろ新入社員歓迎会でもします？
conversation.en_sentence: Should we plan a welcome party for the new employee soon?

conversation.ja_sentence: 配属されて２週間経つしね。
conversation.en_sentence: It has been two weeks since they have been assigned.

conversation.ja_sentence: 来週末あたりにセッティングしますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Do you want to schedule it the week after next?

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだね、後でみんなの予定を確認するとして。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good, we will check everybody's schedule later.

conversation.ja_sentence: どこでやるか、ってことですよね。
conversation.en_sentence: We need to discuss where we are going to have it.

conversation.ja_sentence: 週末だし、どうせ３次会くらいまでにはなりそうだね。
conversation.en_sentence: Since it's a weekend, we will probably end up going to a couple of more places for after-party.

conversation.ja_sentence: 相変わらず、みんな酒豪そうだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Everybody seems heavyweight as usual.

conversation.ja_sentence: となると、またいつもの居酒屋ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Then should we go to the same Izakaya as always?

conversation.ja_sentence: たまには別のところがいいな。
conversation.en_sentence: We could try somewhere else for a change.

conversation.ja_sentence: どういうジャンルにしますか？
conversation.en_sentence: What kind of food should we choose?

conversation.ja_sentence: 中華料理とかどう？
conversation.en_sentence: How about Chinese?

conversation.ja_sentence: 円卓囲めば、より一層親睦を深められそうだ。
conversation.en_sentence: We could bond much easier if everybody sits facing one another at a round table.

conversation.ja_sentence: 中華料理ですか、結構こってり系ですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Chinese food, it's a little heavy.

conversation.ja_sentence: 若い社員がメインだからね。
conversation.en_sentence: We have mostly young employees.

conversation.ja_sentence: 私は軽く前菜をつまみながら紹興酒でも飲むかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I will probably enjoy appetizers over Shaoxing wine.

conversation.ja_sentence: 高田さんおすすめの中華のお店はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Takada-san, do you have any recommendation for Chinese food?

conversation.ja_sentence: それだったらRホテルの地下にある中華料理でどう？
conversation.en_sentence: How about the Chinese restaurant in the basement of R hotel?

conversation.ja_sentence: 人数確定したら私が予約しておくよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I will make a reservation once I get a head count.

conversation.ja_sentence: あそこだったら、ここから近いし、二次会用に最上階のバーもあるしね。
conversation.en_sentence: That place is close by and has a bar on the top floor we can go for after-party.

conversation.ja_sentence: 参加メンバーが泥酔しても無理して連れて帰らないで泊まらせられるな。
conversation.en_sentence: If somebody gets wasted, we could just let them spend the night there instead of forcing them to go home.

conversation.ja_sentence: 終電過ぎでもタクシーが待機してますから心置きなくの飲めますね。
conversation.en_sentence: There will be cabs waiting even if we miss the last train.

conversation.ja_sentence: 会費はいくらにしますか？
conversation.en_sentence: How much should each person pay?

conversation.ja_sentence: 当然ながら新入社員は無料でしょ。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course the new employees pay nothing.

conversation.ja_sentence: あとは役職が上がるごとに金額をあげていくといいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: The higher the title, the price should go up for the rest of the employees.

conversation.ja_sentence: 参加人数が確定してから、レストランとコース内容を相談してみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Once the number is confirmed, I will discuss the course menu with the restaurant.

conversation.ja_sentence: 金額も私が決めちゃうね。
conversation.en_sentence: I am going to go ahead and decide on the price as well.

conversation.ja_sentence: 一般社員は安めにお願いしますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I hope it will be reasonable for the general employees.

conversation.ja_sentence: 役職なしの社員は5千円位に設定しようかな。
conversation.en_sentence: I will probably set the price for about 5000 yens for the non-managerial employees.

conversation.ja_sentence: マネージャー以上は、ちょっと覚悟してもらおうかな。
conversation.en_sentence: Managers might want to brace themselves though.

conversation.ja_sentence: マネージャー以上には俺から伝えるから心配しなくていいよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Don't you worry I will personally talk to the managers about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: ところで、二次会の支払いは、いつもどうしているんですか？
conversation.en_sentence: By the way, how do you normally pay for the after party?

conversation.ja_sentence: みんな知らないだろうけど、実は参加している部長以上でじゃんけんして負けた人が全額支払っているんだよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Not everybody knows this, but everybody above managerial positions plays Rock Paper Scissors, and whoever loses pays the full amount.

conversation.ja_sentence: え、そうなんですか、初耳です。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, wow, I have never heard about it.

conversation.ja_sentence: ちなみに先月の二次会、支払ったのは私ね。
conversation.en_sentence: For your information, it was me who paid for the after party last month.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうだったんですか、その節はごちそうさまでした。
conversation.en_sentence: I did not know that, thank you so much for that.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、浅野です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is Asano.

conversation.ja_sentence: 秘書室の中田です。
conversation.en_sentence: This is Nakada from executive assistance office.

conversation.ja_sentence: 社長室にいらしていただけますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Would you come to the president's office?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、すぐに参ります。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'll be there right away.

conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼します、事業開発部の浅野です。
conversation.en_sentence: Excuse me, this is Asano from business development department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 浅野君、急に呼び立ててすまないね。
conversation.en_sentence: Mr. Asano, sorry for calling you to come in such a short notice.

conversation.ja_sentence: 以前から話に出てきた君の海外赴任についてだ。
conversation.en_sentence: This is about you relocating to overseas which we have been talking about.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes.

conversation.ja_sentence: ５月１日付けで君にロサンゼルスに行ってもらうことになった。
conversation.en_sentence: We are assigning you to go to Los Angeles as of May 1st.

conversation.ja_sentence: ロサンゼルスですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Los Angeles?

conversation.ja_sentence: どうもありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君はサンフランシスコを希望していたようだが、ロサンゼルスで事業拡大の機会を調査してもらいたい。
conversation.en_sentence: I know you wanted to go to San Francisco, but I want you to research opportunities to expand our business in Los Angeles.

conversation.ja_sentence: 憧れのカリフォルニアだなんてありがたいです。
conversation.en_sentence: I am grateful to go to California that I admire.

conversation.ja_sentence: 任期は最低３年、場合によっては延長となる。
conversation.en_sentence: Your term will be at least three years, and it will be extended depending on circumstances.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご家族はどうするかね？
conversation.en_sentence: What are your going to do about your family?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、子供はまだ幼稚園ですし、妻も留学経験があるので家族で赴任したいです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, my child is still in kindergarten, and my wife has an experience studying overseas, so I would like to relocate with my family.

conversation.ja_sentence: それがいいね。
conversation.en_sentence: Sounds good.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君のビザはすぐに申請するので再来月に間に合うと思うが、ご家族のビザはもう少し時間がかかるかもしれない。
conversation.en_sentence: We will apply your visa soon, so it will hopefully be issued in time by the month after next, but visas for your family might take longer.

conversation.ja_sentence: ビザはＬ１だ。
conversation.en_sentence: Your visa will be L1.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、承知しております。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I am aware.

conversation.ja_sentence: まず君が先に行って、後からご家族が渡米だな。
conversation.en_sentence: You will go there first, then your family will go to US afterwards.

conversation.ja_sentence: 最初の一年の住居はロサンゼルス支社が決めるが、２年目は予算内なら自分で探したところに引っ越してもいい。
conversation.en_sentence: Your first year residence will be determined by our Los Angeles office, but you may move to a place that you find on the second year, as long as it is within our budget.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I understand.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君が慣れるまでロサンゼルス支社の田沼君にしばらく君のお世話を頼むことにする。
conversation.en_sentence: I will ask Mr. Tanuma from Los Angeles office to take care of you until you find your way around.

conversation.ja_sentence: 田沼さんのことは伺ったことあります。
conversation.en_sentence: I have heard about Mr. Tanuma.

conversation.ja_sentence: アメリカ生まれだが、日本語も完璧な優秀な人だよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Although he was born in the US, his Japanese is perfect, and he is excellent all around.

conversation.ja_sentence: そのように聞いてます。
conversation.en_sentence: That's what I heard.

conversation.ja_sentence: 車も会社持ちでリースするが、まずは運転免許の取得が必要だ。
conversation.en_sentence: Your car will be leased by the company, but you need to get a driver's license first.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうですね。
conversation.en_sentence: I agree.

conversation.ja_sentence: お子さんの幼稚園も考えないといかんな。
conversation.en_sentence: You have to think about your child's kindergarten.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは妻に調べさせます。
conversation.en_sentence: I will have my wife research on that.

conversation.ja_sentence: 赴任の準備で忙しくなるが、よろしく頼む。
conversation.en_sentence: You will be busy preparing for the move, please take care.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、ずっと希望していた海外赴任なので大丈夫です。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, working overseas is what I have been wanting to do, so I will be fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: このために心構えはありましたので。
conversation.en_sentence: I have been mentally preparing for this.

conversation.ja_sentence: それは良かった。
conversation.en_sentence: Glad to hear.

conversation.ja_sentence: 君には期待しているよ。
conversation.en_sentence: I am counting on you.

conversation.ja_sentence: 我が社の海外事業拡大のカギだ。
conversation.en_sentence: You are the key to expand our company's business overseas.

conversation.ja_sentence: 恐れ入ります。
conversation.en_sentence: I feel humble.

conversation.ja_sentence: 全力で頑張ります。
conversation.en_sentence: I will do my best.

conversation.ja_sentence: 赴任前に一度一緒に夕食はどうだ？
conversation.en_sentence: Why don't we have dinner together before you move?

conversation.ja_sentence: さて、本題に入りましょうか。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, shall we go right in to it.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、本日は当社の新製品をお見せしたいのです。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, I'd like to show our company's new product today.

conversation.ja_sentence: こちらが、ハイスペックカメラです。
conversation.en_sentence: This is the high-spec camera.

conversation.ja_sentence: どうぞご覧下さい。
conversation.en_sentence: Please take a look.

conversation.ja_sentence: 前のモデルとの違いは何ですか？
conversation.en_sentence: What's the difference from the previous model.

conversation.ja_sentence: まず、機能が増えております。
conversation.en_sentence: First of all, there are more functions.

conversation.ja_sentence: しかし、この商品の一番の特徴はその小ささです。
conversation.en_sentence: However, the number one feature of this product is this compact size.

conversation.ja_sentence: 開発に2年かかっております。
conversation.en_sentence: It took 2 years to develop this.

conversation.ja_sentence: 確かに、この小ささはすごいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: This small size is indeed impressive.

conversation.ja_sentence: よく売れているのですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is it selling well?

conversation.ja_sentence: もちろんです。
conversation.en_sentence: Of course.

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の人気商品です。
conversation.en_sentence: It is our company's popular product.

conversation.ja_sentence: なるほど。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の製品は、品質の良さと手ごろな値段で評判が良いです。
conversation.en_sentence: Our company's product is well received for its good quality and reasonable price.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうなのですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Is that right.

conversation.ja_sentence: そちらが提示された価格について話し合いたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I wanted to talk about the price that you are proposing.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、カメラの単価は8万となっております。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, the camera's unit price is 80,000 yen.

conversation.ja_sentence: 大量購入に対する割引はありますか？
conversation.en_sentence: Is there a discount for purchasing in large lots?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、100個のご購入に対し、５パーセント割引可能です。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, we can provide a 5 percent discount for buying 100 of them.

conversation.ja_sentence: 価格をもう少し下げてもらえませんか？
conversation.en_sentence: Can you lower the price a bit more?

conversation.ja_sentence: 残念ながら、それはむずかしいですね。
conversation.en_sentence: Unfortunately, that will be a bit difficult.

conversation.ja_sentence: これが、当社が提供できる精一杯の価格となっております。
conversation.en_sentence: This is the best price our company can offer.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかりました。
conversation.en_sentence: I see.

conversation.ja_sentence: 他の納入業者と価格を比較し、また改めてご連絡します。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to compare the price with other suppliers and I'll get back to you accordingly.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: ご検討宜しくお願い致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Please do consider us.

conversation.ja_sentence: 友井さん、ちょっとよろしいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: Tomoi-san, do you have a moment?

conversation.ja_sentence: どうしたの？
conversation.en_sentence: What's wrong?

conversation.ja_sentence: 今度、新規でA社様にシステムを導入することになりまして。
conversation.en_sentence: We will be newly implementing Company A's system next time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 当社の既存の契約書でお願いしたいと思い、雛形を提示したんです。
conversation.en_sentence: I thought of asking them to use our existing contract so I showed them our template.

conversation.ja_sentence: そうしたら、先方の顧問弁護士事務所から指摘事項があったみたいで。
conversation.en_sentence: But there were sections pointed out by their legal counsel.

conversation.ja_sentence: いくつか文言の変更を打診されたんですが、どうすればいいですか？
conversation.en_sentence: They asked to change some of the language but what should we do?

conversation.ja_sentence: 具体的には？
conversation.en_sentence: What exactly was it?

conversation.ja_sentence: この資料の通りです。
conversation.en_sentence: It's as this document shows.

conversation.ja_sentence: 先方も、法務部経由で顧問弁護士とやりとりしているみたいです。
conversation.en_sentence: It seems they are also dealing with their legal counsel through the legal department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 契約の締結は直接法務部とやってほしい、と言われています。
conversation.en_sentence: They told us to execute the contract directly with the legal department.

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、この資料と先方の法務部担当の方の連絡先をメールで俺に送ってくれる？
conversation.en_sentence: Then, can you send me this document and the contact information of the person in charge at the legal department by email?

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 俺から、うちの顧問弁護士と相談してみる。
conversation.en_sentence: I will consult with our legal counsel.

conversation.ja_sentence: その上で、俺から先方の法務担当に連絡して契約書を詰めるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Afterwards, I will contact the person in charge of legal affairs on their side and figure out the contract.

conversation.ja_sentence: ありがとうございます。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much.

conversation.ja_sentence: 契約締結の期限は？
conversation.en_sentence: What's the deadline on executing the contract?

conversation.ja_sentence: 新システムの導入、先方の希望は２月１日です。
conversation.en_sentence: Their request is February 1st which is when the new system will be implemented.

conversation.ja_sentence: あと３ヶ月あるのね。
conversation.en_sentence: So we still have three months.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、しかし実質の導入作業は来月から始めないと間に合わないので。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, but the actual implementation work will have to start from next month otherwise we won't make it in time.

conversation.ja_sentence: 作業開始までには契約関係をクリアしたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to get the contract related matters out of the way by the time we start the work.

conversation.ja_sentence: わかった、早速うちの顧問弁護士と相談してみるよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I'll talk to our legal counsel right away.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、席に戻り次第、資料をメールで送ります。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will send you the document by email once I get back to my seat.

conversation.ja_sentence: うん、よろしくね。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, thank you.

title: 株主総会への臨場要請に関するアポイントメント取り

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、警視庁C警察署です。
conversation.en_sentence: Hello this is Metropolitan Police Department C police station.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつも大変お世話になっております、I社の高田と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as always, my name is Takada from Company I.

conversation.ja_sentence: 恐れ入りますが、組織犯罪対策課にお取り次ぎいただけませんでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry but can you transfer me to the Organized Crime Department?

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お待ちください。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, please hold.

conversation.ja_sentence: 電話代わりました、組織犯罪対策課です。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you for holding, this is the Organized Crime Department.

conversation.ja_sentence: いつも大変お世話になっております、I社で株主総会の運営を担当しております高田と申します。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you as always, my name is Takada and I'm in charge of running the general meeting of shareholders for Company I.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、こんにちは。
conversation.en_sentence: Yes, hello.

conversation.ja_sentence: この度、弊社の株主総会開催の日時が決定しましたので、臨場をお願いしたく存じます。
conversation.en_sentence: We have decided the date and time for our company's general meeting of shareholders and would like to ask you for your presence there.

conversation.ja_sentence: つきましては、臨場の要請書をお持ちした上で、一度直接ご挨拶をさせていただきたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Thus I'd like to drop by once with the application for the request.

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、そうですか。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh is that right?

conversation.ja_sentence: いつくらいに来られます？
conversation.en_sentence: Around when will you be coming?

conversation.ja_sentence: そちらのご都合よろしい時に伺いたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: I'd like to come at a time that works with your side.

conversation.ja_sentence: 今はそんなに事件が込み合っていないので、いつでもいいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: We're not too busy with cases right now so anytime is fine.

conversation.ja_sentence: それでは、明日の午後にでも伺いたいのですが。
conversation.en_sentence: Then can I drop by tomorrow afternoon?

conversation.ja_sentence: お時間どうしましょう？
conversation.en_sentence: When is a good time?

conversation.ja_sentence: じゃあ、午後５時くらいに来てもらえますか？
conversation.en_sentence: How about getting you to come around 5 o'clock in the afternoon?

conversation.ja_sentence: 了解致しました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 恐縮ですが、どなた様宛に伺えばよろしいでしょうか？
conversation.en_sentence: Sorry, who should I look for?

conversation.ja_sentence: ああ、私宛でいいですよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Oh, you can just look for me.

conversation.ja_sentence: 警部補の多田と言います。
conversation.en_sentence: My name is Tada and I'm the assistant inspector.

conversation.ja_sentence: 多田様でいらっしゃいますね？
conversation.en_sentence: So it's Mr. Tada?

conversation.ja_sentence: 承りました。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay.

conversation.ja_sentence: 明日の午後５時に、わたくし、I社の高田が伺います。
conversation.en_sentence: I, Takada from Company I will go to your place at 5 o'clock in the afternoon tomorrow.

conversation.ja_sentence: はい、お待ちしていますよ。
conversation.en_sentence: Okay, I will wait for you.

conversation.ja_sentence: お忙しい中のご対応、ありがとうございました。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for dealing with me despite being busy.

conversation.ja_sentence: 失礼致します。
conversation.en_sentence: Bye now.

title: 株主総会に関する役員向け説明（３）

conversation.ja_sentence: 皆様、お疲れ様でした。
conversation.en_sentence: Thank you very much for your hard work everyone.

conversation.ja_sentence: 総会の練習をシナリオ通りにしてみましたが、いかがでしたでしょうか？
